title: Chapter 1: Dust and Echoes
content:
The wind howled across the barren landscape, kicking up swirls of copper dust. It had been three days since the signal died.

"Are you sure this is the right coordinates?" Kael asked, squinting at the datapad.

Lena didn't look up. "The sensor doesn't lie, Kael. It's here. Or at least... what's left of it is here."

title: Chapter 2: Beneath the Surface
content: They descended into the cavern, the air growing cooler with every step. The light from the surface faded into a pinprick above them. Suddenly, Kael stopped. "Listen." A low hum vibrated through the rock walls. It wasn't mechanical. It felt alive.
